00049 static const int BESTSOUNDRATE(44100);

00058 CMilesAudio::CMilesAudio():
00059         digDriverHandle(NULL),

00069 // Initializes the wave driver
00070 void CMilesAudio::InitializeWaveDriver()
00071 {
00072    static PCMWAVEFORMAT sPCMWF;
00073    HDIGDRIVER            DIG;
00074    DWORD                 r;
00075    char                  buf[128];
00076 
00077    //
00078    // default sound output
00079    //
00080 
00081    //
00082    // try to use DirectSound with MSS mixer
00083    //
00084 
00085    AIL_set_preference(DIG_USE_WAVEOUT, NO);
00086 
00087 
00088    //
00089    // Attempt waveOutOpen()
00090    //
00091 
00092    while (digitalRate>=11025) 
00093    {
00094 
00095      sPCMWF.wf.wFormatTag      = WAVE_FORMAT_PCM;
00096      sPCMWF.wf.nChannels       = (U16)digitalChans;
00097      sPCMWF.wf.nSamplesPerSec  = digitalRate;
00098      sPCMWF.wf.nAvgBytesPerSec = digitalRate * (digitalBits / 8) * digitalChans;
00099      sPCMWF.wf.nBlockAlign     = (U16)( (digitalBits / 8) * digitalChans);
00100      sPCMWF.wBitsPerSample     = (U16)digitalBits;
00101 
00102      r = AIL_waveOutOpen(&DIG,0,WAVE_MAPPER,(LPWAVEFORMAT) &sPCMWF);
00103 
00104      if (r==0)
00105        {
00106 
00107        //
00108        // the waveOut succeeded!
00109        //
00110 
00111        //
00112        // get the text description of the sound driver
00113        //
00114 
00115        strcpy(buf,"Device: ");
00116        AIL_digital_configuration(DIG,0,0,buf+strlen(buf));
00117 
00118 
00119        //
00120        // if we're using DirectSound, check to see if it is in emulated
00121        // mode.  if so, then close the device and re-open with waveOut
00122        //
00123 
00124        if (AIL_get_preference(DIG_USE_WAVEOUT)==FALSE)
00125          {
00126 
00127            //
00128            // see if DirectSound is emulated
00129            //
00130 
00131            if ( strstr(buf, "Emulated") )
00132              {
00133 
00134              //
00135              // we're emulated, so close down the driver and reset the
00136              // preference
00137              //
00138 
00139              AIL_waveOutClose(DIG);
00140 
00141              AIL_set_preference(DIG_USE_WAVEOUT, TRUE);
00142 
00143              goto DSerror;
00144 
00145              }
00146 
00147          }
00148 
00149 
00150            digDriverHandle=DIG;
00151        return;
00152        }
00153 
00154         if (AIL_get_preference(DIG_USE_WAVEOUT)==FALSE)
00155         {
00156 
00157                 DSerror:
00158 
00159                 //
00160                 // DirectSound didn't work, so let's try waveOut
00161                 //
00162 
00163                 AIL_set_preference(DIG_USE_WAVEOUT, TRUE);
00164 
00165      }
00166 
00167      else
00168      {
00169                 //
00170                 // this rate didn't work, try a slower rate
00171                 //
00172 
00173                 digitalRate=digitalRate/2;
00174 
00175                 //
00176                 // if all of the 16-bit opens have failed, try 8-bit
00177                 //
00178 
00179                 if ((digitalRate<11025) && (digitalBits==8)) 
00180                 {
00181                         digitalRate=BESTSOUNDRATE;
00182                         digitalBits=8;
00183                 }
00184      }
00185    }
00186 
00187    //
00188    // no drivers could be loaded
00189    //
00190 
00191    digDriverHandle = NULL;
00192 }//end InitializeWaveDriver

00195 //Allocate a sample handle for the newborn sound (used by CSoundResource) and tell you it's length
00196 IAudioBuffer *CMilesAudio::VInitAudioBuffer(shared_ptr<CSoundResource> soundResource)//const
00197 {
00198         const char* fileExtension = CAudio::FindExtFromSoundType(soundResource->GetSoundType());
00199 
00200         if (digDriverHandle == NULL)
00201                 return NULL;
00202 
00203         switch(soundResource->GetSoundType())
00204         {
00205                 case SOUND_TYPE_WAVE:
00206                         // WAVs are easy to support.
00207                         break;
00208 
00209                 case SOUND_TYPE_MP3:
00210                         // Miles supports MP3s
00211                         break;
00212 
00213                 case SOUND_TYPE_OGG:
00214                 case SOUND_TYPE_MIDI:   //If it's a midi file, then do nothin at this time... maybe we will support this in the future
00215                         assert(false && "OGGs and MIDI are not supported");
00216                         return NULL;
00217                         break;
00218                 default:
00219                         assert(false && "Unknown sound type");
00220                         return NULL;
00221         }//end switch
00222 
00223         HSAMPLE sampleHandle = AIL_allocate_sample_handle(digDriverHandle);
00224         //KIS(6-13-02) | Analysis of a watson crash indicates that a NULL sample handle
00225         //was passed into AIL_init_sample, which caused the crash.
00226         if(NULL==sampleHandle)
00227         {
00228                 assert(false && "AIL_allocate_sample_handle is expected to return a non-NULL handle");
00229                 return NULL;
00230         }
00231         AIL_init_sample (sampleHandle);
00232 
00233         // Configure sample handle to play data from file image
00234         if (!AIL_set_named_sample_file (sampleHandle, fileExtension, (U32 FAR *)soundResource->GetPCMBuffer(),(S32 FAR) soundResource->GetPCMBufferSize(),0))
00235         {
00236 //              MessageBox(hwnd,"No ASI provider(decoder) available for file type","Error", MB_OK);
00237                 AIL_release_sample_handle(sampleHandle);
00238                 return(NULL);
00239         }
00240 
00241         // Set initial volume and rate
00242         int pitch=64;   //pitch
00243         U32 smpRate=AIL_sample_playback_rate(sampleHandle);     
00244         AIL_set_sample_playback_rate(sampleHandle, ((pitch + 1L) * smpRate) / 64L);
00245 
00246         //long lengthMilli;
00247         //AIL_sample_ms_position(sampleHandle, &lengthMilli, NULL);
00248 
00249         // Add handle to the list
00250         IAudioBuffer *audioBuffer = (IAudioBuffer *)(new CMilesAudioBuffer(sampleHandle, soundResource));
00251         m_AllSamples.insert( m_AllSamples.begin(), audioBuffer);
00252         
00253         return audioBuffer;
00254 
00255 }//end AllocateSampleHandle
00256 
00257 
00258 //Allocate a sample handle for the newborn sound (used by CSoundResource)
00259 void CMilesAudio::VReleaseAudioBuffer(IAudioBuffer *sampleHandle)//const
00260 {
00261         AIL_end_sample(HSAMPLE(sampleHandle->VGet()));
00262         m_AllSamples.remove(sampleHandle);
00263         AIL_release_sample_handle(HSAMPLE(sampleHandle->VGet()));
00264 }//end ReleaseSampleHandle

00267 // Initializes the sound system
00268 void CMilesAudio::Initialize()
00269 {
00270         if(m_Initialized)
00271         {
00272                 return;
00273         }
00274 
00275         m_Initialized=true;
00276 
00277         digitalRate=BESTSOUNDRATE;
00278         digitalBits=16;
00279         digitalChans=2;
00280 
00281         //
00282         // Initialize the Miles Sound System
00283         //
00284 
00285         AIL_startup();
00286 
00287         //This would double the size of the secondary buffer used by DirectSound
00288         //AIL_set_preference(DIG_DS_SECONDARY_SIZE, 65536);
00289 
00290         //This would double the size of the output buffer used by everything but DirectSound
00291         //AIL_set_preference(DIG_OUTPUT_BUFFER_SIZE, 98304);
00292 
00293         InitializeWaveDriver();
00294 
00295         if(digDriverHandle==NULL)
00296         {
00297                 return;
00298         }
00299 
00300 #ifdef USE_BINK
00301         if (g_TellBinkToUseDirectSound)
00302         {
00303                 //Specify which sound system Bink will use
00304                 BinkSoundUseDirectSound(NULL);
00305                 //BinkSoundUseMiles(digDriverHandle);
00306         }
00307 #endif
00308 
00309         m_AllSamples.clear();
00310 
00311 }//end Initialize

00314 // Plays .wav and .mp3 sounds, volume falls between 0 and 100
00315 bool CMilesAudioBuffer::PlayWave(int volume, bool looping)
00316 {
00317         HSAMPLE sampleHandle = (HSAMPLE)VGet();
00318         if (!g_Audio->VActive())
00319         {
00320                 return(false);
00321         }
00322 
00323         assert(volume>=0 && volume<=100 && "Volume must be a number between 0 and 100");
00324         //Sample volume is adjusted to a number between 0 and 120
00325         AIL_set_sample_volume(sampleHandle, volume*120/100);
00326 
00327         // Activate sample      
00328         AIL_start_sample(sampleHandle);
00329 
00330         if(looping)
00331         {
00332                 AIL_set_sample_loop_count(sampleHandle,0);
00333         }
00334         else
00335         {
00336                 AIL_set_sample_loop_count(sampleHandle,1);
00337         }
00338 
00339         return(true);
00340 }//end PlayWave

00344 //Stop all active sounds, including music
00345 void CMilesAudio::VStopAllSounds()
00346 {
00347         if (DLSData)
00348         {
00349                 AIL_mem_free_lock(DLSData);
00350                 DLSData=NULL;
00351         }
00352 
00353         m_AllPaused=false;
00354         
00355 }//end StopAllSounds
00356 
00357 
00358 //Play a sound
00359 bool CMilesAudioBuffer::VPlay(int volume, bool looping)
00360 {
00361         if (!g_Audio->VActive())
00362                 return false;
00363 
00364         m_Volume = volume;
00365         m_isLooping = looping;
00366 
00367         //Initialize();
00368         VStop();
00369 
00370         if ( PlayWave(volume, looping ) )
00371         {
00372                 return true;
00373         }
00374 
00375         return false;
00376 
00377 }//end Play
00378 
00379 
00380 //Stop a sound
00381 bool CMilesAudioBuffer::VStop()
00382 {
00383         HSAMPLE sampleHandle = (HSAMPLE)VGet();
00384 
00385         if(!g_Audio->VActive())
00386         {
00387                 return false;
00388         }
00389         m_isPaused = true;
00390 
00391         AIL_stop_sample(sampleHandle);
00392 
00393         return true;
00394 }
00395 
00396 //Resume a sound
00397 bool CMilesAudioBuffer::VResume()
00398 {
00399         HSAMPLE sampleHandle = (HSAMPLE)VGet();
00400 
00401         if (g_Audio->VActive())
00402         {
00403                 AIL_resume_sample(sampleHandle);
00404                 m_isPaused = false;
00405         }
00406 
00407         return true;
00408 }
00409 
00410 //Pause a sound or Resume a Paused sound
00411 bool CMilesAudioBuffer::VTogglePause()
00412 {
00413         HSAMPLE sampleHandle = (HSAMPLE)VGet();
00414 
00415         if(m_isPaused)
00416         {
00417                 m_isPaused=false;
00418                 AIL_resume_sample(sampleHandle);
00419         }
00420         else
00421         {
00422                 m_isPaused=true;
00423                 AIL_stop_sample(sampleHandle);
00424         }
00425         return true;
00426 }//end TogglePause

00429 // Uninitializes the sound system
00430 void CMilesAudio::VShutdown()
00431 {
00432         if(m_Initialized)
00433         {
00434                 CAudio::VShutdown();
00435                 AIL_shutdown();
00436         }
00437 }//end Uninitialize

00440 bool CMilesAudioBuffer::VIsPlaying()
00441 {
00442         HSAMPLE sampleHandle = (HSAMPLE)VGet();
00443 
00444         if (sampleHandle)
00445         {
00446                 if(sampleHandle)
00447                 {
00448                         if(SMP_PLAYING==AIL_sample_status(sampleHandle))
00449                         {
00450                                 return(true);
00451                         }
00452                 }
00453                 return(false);
00454         }
00455         else
00456         {
00457                 return(false);
00458         }
00459 }

00462 void CMilesAudioBuffer::VSetVolume(int volume)
00463 {
00464         m_Volume = volume;
00465         HSAMPLE sampleHandle = (HSAMPLE)VGet();
00466 
00467         assert(volume>=0 && volume<=100 && "Volume must be a number between 0 and 100");
00468 
00469         //Sample volume is adjusted to a number between 0 and 120
00470         AIL_set_sample_volume(sampleHandle, volume*120/100);
00471 }//end SetVolume
